This has identified trees that have grown close to 2 spans of cable, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers may have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Horsham Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. Two way traffic lights will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Following a third-party request, we will be upgrading a transformer on our electricity network to allow for a new connection to be made. We will also be upgrading the overhead electricity cables. Once completed this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in your area, ensuring that the network can cope with the increased electricity demand and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate that some customers may have experienced an unplanned power cut in the last 6 months. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we install the new transformer. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work is taking place near The Holloway and Tring Hill.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 19:05 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Sparsholt Road area again. The recent issues were being caused by an unexpected underground network fault.

We know this has interrupted your power several times, and we're sorry for the repeated interruption. We don't expect this issue to affect your power again, but we'll monitor the situation closely. Rest assured our staff will work around the clock to get your lights back on.

If your power isn't on, or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105, free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Message:

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Aaron at 02:15 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repaired the underground network fault in the Leathwell Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Aaron at 01:24

Sent by Aaron at 23:38 -

We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu
 
If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 07:26 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power around the fault on the underground network in the Longridge Road area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only six properties without power, who we'll speak to directly as we need access to the premises in order to restore supply. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi there. We've just had a shift change, so Talie, Theo, Simon and David are now here to keep you updated with progress from our field teams.

We know it's frustrating being without power, but we wanted to assure you we're still here and as soon as we have some more information we'll update you again.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 05:48 - I'm very sorry you're still without power.

We'll let you know as soon as our staff re-attend and we have some more information, but if you have any concerns in the meantime you can always reach our team here on 105.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 02:43 - We can now confirm that all power in the Islington High Street area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Islington High Street area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Aaron at 01:26.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 00:55 - Our staff are on the way to the Islington High Street area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 04:00 and 05:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Simon at 13:13 - We can now confirm that all power in the Maidstone ME15/ME16  area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around where our overhead cables turn to underground to get the majority of customers back on. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 12:14 - Our staff have made progress connecting the temporary generators, so a further 43 homes and businesses now have their lights safely back on. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: An underground electricity cable faulted on our high voltage network, causing an area wide power cut.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Simon at 13:13 - We can now confirm that all power in the Maidstone ME15/ME16  area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around where our overhead cables turn to underground to get the majority of customers back on. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Simon at 12:14 - Our staff have made progress connecting the temporary generators, so a further 43 homes and businesses now have their lights safely back on.

We know there's still 20 properties affected by the power cut, and if your power is still off, don't worry - we'll continue to send you updates from our staff.

We may send a few texts like this, so if your power has come back on now, or does at any point later on, just follow this link to stop our SMS updates https://bit.ly/348KOZ3.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 03:46 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1735 customers in the NR11 8/NR27 9 area, by diverting power around the overhead network fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 03:13 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead network fault that initially interrupted power to 1735 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 353 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 05:30-06:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 13:36 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs to a fault on the overhead network in the Saffron Walden CB10 2 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage and how long you were off for. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.

Sent by Theo at 08:16 - Our engineers have restored power to all 633 properties in the Royston SG8 9 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around an overhead network fault.

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 07:38 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Theo from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Simon at 08:59 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 53 customers in the Guildford GU5 area, by removing debris from the overhead cables. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 08:16 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 08:54 - We can now confirm that all power in the Maidstone Road area should be back on.

To fix the issue permanently we're trying to find the underlying root cause, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Maidstone Road area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 11:30-12:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Simon at 08:04.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 07:00 - We're sorry your power has gone off again. We are sending our engineers back to the Maidstone Road area to investigate why.

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 11:30 and 12:30, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Ebony and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. Today's power cut was caused by another company that had snapped the overhead pole and brought down the overhead cables; with safety in mind, we had to turn off power to 395 properties, so I'm sorry that we weren't able to provide you with prior notice. I'm pleased to say our staff have now repaired to get your lights back on as soon as possible. We contact customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in future let us know here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L I personally apologise for the disruption this caused you. If you'd like to talk to us about anything or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 13:31 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we initially estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our overhead network in the CB1, CB9 and CB21 area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Theo at 13:00.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 12:03 - Just another check in from us, as we know power being off for longer periods can be very disruptive, and we just wanted to help explain why it can take longer to get power restored safely during bad weather like we're having at the moment.

With high winds, our engineers cannot safely do some of the things they need to, such as climb electricity poles. Added to this, heavy rain can make it difficult to travel and access our equipment.

We want to get your power back on as quickly as we can, but the safety of our staff and customers is always our first priority, so we sometimes have to wait until the weather has improved before repairs can begin.

My team and I will continue to keep you updated.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 11:36 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 152 customers in the NR15 2 area, by removing a tree from the overhead network. We know a power cut can be difficult; so we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's David from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Theo at 10:27 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 84 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 35 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 08:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Our engineers had to redirect power due to a fault on the electricity network.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Theo at 11:36 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 152 customers in the NR15 2 area, by removing a tree from the overhead network. We know a power cut can be difficult; so we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 09:07 - We can now confirm that all power in the Bridle Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Bridle Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 12:00 and 13:00; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Theo at 08:52.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 13:52 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 18 customers in the Little Easton area, by diverting power around an overhead network fault. We know your power may have been off for a long time, so we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your patience today. We know a power cut can be difficult, especially in colder weather.

Many properties have gas hobs, which can still be used in a power cut for cooking, or heating water for drinks and sterilisation of baby bottles. The spark to ignite the hob will not work however, so if you do use it please take extra care when using other ignition sources like matches or lighters. Even in daytime, the light in your house may be low in a power cut, so only do this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always on hand to help.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:23 - We've liaised with our engineers, and they have advised that they are in the process of patrolling our overhead cabling and checking the network for any visible problems. As they do this, they will identify healthy sections of cable which we can attempt to use to divert power around the fault.

Our estimated time frame of 13:30-14:30 hasn't changed.  However, I will personally be keeping an eye on this, and I'll continue to update you with further news.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 11:43 - Thanks for your patience today, we're happy to say our staff have now restored power to all but one property in the Hotham Close area. I'm sorry for any disruption we caused by having to turn off your power to make the area safe following an overhead cable that had come down on the ground.

We'd still like to keep you informed if your electricity hasn't been restored. Please call us free any time on 08003163105 if we haven't already reached out to you by phone or in person at your property.

We apologise for the outage and understand that being without power can be challenging. Rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep your lights on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:28 - Hi David here from the messaging team. I'm so sorry that power is still off this afternoon. I just wated to let you know.


Our engineers have let us know that they have found that a tree has fallen onto our overhead cables that have brought our overhead cables down to the ground which they now need to remove and repair to restore your power in the CO9 3 area. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 14:30 and 15:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 10:47 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now investigated the grounded overhead cable, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 381 properties in the Swanley BR8 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

We have been alerted to a potentially dangerous situation involving an overhead cable that is on the ground, so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Once further specialist field staff have assessed the situation, we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 09:37 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Swanley BR8 area in the interest of the public's health and safety. This is so they can investigate reports of an overhead cable that is on the ground.

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Until our engineers arrive on site and investigate, it's difficult to advise you a time frame. However, based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 12:30 and 13:30. 

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Simon from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 13:10 - We've liaised with our engineers, and they have advised that they are in the process of patrolling our overhead cabling and checking the network for any visible problems. As they do this, they will identify healthy sections of cable which we can attempt to use to divert power around the fault.

Our estimated time frame of 15:30-16:30 hasn't changed. However, I will personally be keeping an eye on this, and I'll continue to update you with further news.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 13:10 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Engineers have arrived on site in the Ham Lane area to investigate the overhead network fault currently affecting 20 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 15:30 and 16:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.

Sent by Simon at 12:20.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 15:30 and 16:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 13:50 - Thanks for your patience this afternoon.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Simon from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I'm sorry for the power cut today; I know the lights going off can be disruptive.

We know that some customers affected by todays power cut may have had other issues recently, and I appreciate this is frustrating. High voltage cabling can cover a wide area, so sometimes properties very close to you may have had power cuts that you didn't experience.

I know you may not have had any previous power cuts, but if you have, we often get progress updates from our field staff management about investigations into repeat issues, and our Customer Services team will try to contact everyone affected by them to explain what's happening.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Sheerness ME12 area to investigate the power cut affecting 147 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Simon at 13:23.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 12:44 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead network fault affecting 147 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 15:30 and 16:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 13:54 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Vaughan Road area, the estimated time of 16:30-17:30 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Theo at 13:48.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 13:07 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Vaughan Road area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 16:30 and 17:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this afternoon. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Simon at 13:52.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the High Street area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 17:30-18:30 hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Simon at 13:24.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 12:52 - Our staff are on the way to the High Street area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 17:30 and 18:30. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Steps.Message:
Engineers have arrived on site in the IP7 6 and IP8 4 area to investigate the reports of a faulty piece of overhead electrical equipment currently affecting 443 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 15:30 and 16:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.
